Primary_Text: ekïrï ru man eroang tïmamin ïna
Translated_Text: The old man went to his work,
“Where might my machete be?”, he asked.
So he went looking for it.
He went back into the house.
His machete was under his arm.

Primary_Text: pupa muntu mun, waptakgwam keni owïn
Translated_Text: “Father, your machete is the one under your arm.”

Primary_Text: tïmongmo arawïremkom ankangtom man imun emtxin emuye keni ningkïn emnoptowoge: Kïkïkï ankangtom man.
Translated_Text: His family, his son, his daughter, his wife started laughing (because of all this). Hahaha! They laughed.
